results.title: A Pace ahead
results.creator_credit: Lilias Castle, Norman Castle and Australian Dairy Board
results.brief_description: Research is the basis for new and improved products from the dairy industry. Experimental farms test new breeds of cattle, pastures and fodder harvesting and conservation. Shows milk production, butter making, cheese making, and the by-products of casein and malt, and considers the nearby eastern countries as a tremendous market.

results.title: A One two many world
results.creator_credit: Richard Swinden, Peter Harcourt and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film of cinematic metaphor, made by students of Queen’s University. The world of this film, one in which a growing boy finds himself, is a world of imposed conditions and contradictions. Here children turn adult by putting on the appropriate uniforms - the policeman’s, the soldier’s. Many of the sequences are surrealistic in effect, creating a social commentary expressed in symbolic language.

results.title: A One and a two = Yi yi
results.creator_credit: Edward Yang, Naokto Tsukeda, Shinya Kawai, Pony Canyon, Omega Project and Atom Films
results.brief_description: A ruminative work of great beauty, contemplation and poignancy, “Yi-yi” is a film about three generations of a Taiwanese family, grappling with the notions of regret and acceptance of life’s turbulence. Director Edward Yang (highly regarded for his sprawling masterpiece “Brighter, sunny day”) shows great understanding of the human condition giving his protagonists space for introspection as they reflect over their fate. Winner of Best Director at Cannes 2000, this is an intelligent, detailed piece, which accumulates to create a complex tapestry — about alienation in modern life, dysfunctional families and the desire for happiness. Cast includes: Wu Nien-Jen, Kelly Lee, Elaine Jin, Chen Xisheng, and Jonathan Chang.

results.title: A Nuclear Accident
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “High Office”.
There has been an accident at a nuclear power station and a crisis threatens. Examines how the ministers concerned react and what form the ensuing line of inquiry should take. Among those taking part are former Home Secretary Merlyn Rees and former Environment Secretary Peter Shore

results.title: A Nous la Liberte = Freedom for Us
results.brief_description:
Two convicts, Louis and Emile, escape from prison, but Emile is recaptured. Louis makes his way into the world and advances from gramophone salesman to owner of a huge, modern gramophone factory. When Emile is released, he joins is old cellmate at the plant. After things go wrong, they take to the road together as tramps. Clair has created a sublime musical comedy satire on the work ethics and the dehumanizing effects of mass-production techniques. The film inspired Chaplin’s ‘Modern times’, in which there are similar sequences on the assembly line. Danger in ‘A nous la liberte’ often comes in the form of prophetic images of militaristic domination: the factory guards wear proto-fascist armbands and uniforms. The film equates authoritarianism with capitalist exploitation of the working class. Emile’s one time fellow prisoner, Louis becomes a wealthy industrialist and builds a factory modelled on the prison from which he once escaped. But Emile is the Dada remedy to Louis’s capitalist order. Everywhere he goes, straight lines collapse in confusion and mass production comes to a standstill.” Reference: Alan Williams. ‘Republic of images: a history of French filmmaking’. Harvard University Press, 1992.

Credits: Producer, Frank Clifford ; director, Rene Clair ; writer, Rene Clair ; photography, Georges Perinal ; music, Georges Auric ; art direction, Lazare Meerson.
Cast: Raymond Cordy, Henri Marchand, Rolla France, Paul Olivier, Jacques Shelly, Andre Michaud.

results.title: A Notable tree
results.brief_description: This is the story of a boab tree in Darwin, enduring the test of time, witnessing the changes that take place around it. As it ages, it becomes a monument of nature and a symbol of survival through the history of Darwin. The Adonsonia Gregorii is a bottle-shaped tree endemic to Australia. Some trees can live over one thousand years. Some refer to them as “The Tree of Life”.

results.title: A Normal day
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Secretary”.
Following through a normal day in an office we learn about typical secretarial responsibilities such as making appointments, greeting visitors, processing incoming mail, supervising files, organising a business trip, taking dictation, and transcribing. Emphasises the personal qualities of self direction, tact, willingness to learn, judgment and enthusiasm needed to be a successful secretary.

results.title: A Normal birth
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Education for Childbirth”.
A photographic record of an actual delivery depicting the normal processes of childbirth and the two final stages of labour. The preparation of the mother in the delivery room, the actual birth of the child, and the immediate post-birth care of both mother and child are shown.

results.title: A Nomad boy
results.creator_credit: Denis Hargrave, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and UNICEF
results.brief_description: Portrays Somalia, an African country near the Red Sea, with emphasis on its nomadic camel herders. Features Ismael, a 12-year-old boy, who spends his life searching for pastures for his flocks. Suitable for upper primary and lower seconday levels.

results.title: A Nightmare on Elm Street
results.creator_credit: New Line Cinema, Smart Egg Pictures, Robert Shaye, John Burrows, Sara Risher, Dana Lyman, Gregg Fonseca and Wes Craven
results.brief_description: One, two Freddy’s coming for you. Three, four better lock your doors. Five, six grab a crucifix. Seven, eight better stay up late. Nine, ten never sleep again.

constellations_other.name: Electric Sound Supercut: composers and their distinctive other worlds
constellations_other.description: Electric sound is commonly associated with science fiction narratives for its auditory oddness, which has symbolised other worldly environments, the unconscious and the 1980s.

recommendations.quote: I watched this through a keyhole into the locked TV room where my older siblings watched a bootleg version. When I was caught, the VHS tape was destroyed but the damage was done; I've been an insomniac since.

results.creator_credit_for_label: New Line Cinema, Smart Egg Pictures, Robert Shaye, John Burrows, Sara Risher, Dana Lyman, Gregg Fonseca and Wes Craven
results.description: Teenagers in a small town are dropping like flies, apparently in the grip of mass hysteria causing their suicides. A cop’s daughter, Nancy Thompson, traces the cause to child molester Fred Krueger, who was burned alive by angry parents many years before. Krueger has now come back in the dreams of his killers’ children, claiming their lives as his revenge. Nancy and her boyfriend, Glen, must devise a plan to lure the monster out of the realm of nightmares and into the real world…
